page.title: 04How the Endon Well's Dressed
page.content: The structure used is made up of about twelve panels.Locally dug clay is chopped into small pieces then it is "puddled".The puddlers tread the clay, mixed with water.The panel boards are soaked in water then the clay is spread on to the panels to a thickness of two centimetres and smoothed over.The designer prepares a picture revolving around the theme he wishes to present. (1985-The 150th.Anniversary of the introduction of Methodism into Endon). The outlines of the design are sketched on to the surface and beech cones are used to mark them.Moss,tree bark,lichen and coloured grit are used in the design,together with numerous flower heads.These materials are embedded in the clay to complete the picture.The finished product has to be sprayed with water frequently to keep the flowers fresh.
